moves.4. Qe2: I was hoping for Nf6, Nc6+, getting the queen, but he knows how to protect it
moves.5... Be6: What do you know, extra protection
moves.9... Bxc4 10. Nxc4 Bc5: To put presure on me- not happening
moves.15... Nd3: The following would come if I hadn't played it right-Rd1, NxC1, RxC1, BxB2, forking the rooks
moves.16. Re2 Nxb2 17. d3: Playing it safe, yet loosing 2 pawns in the process anyway
moves.21. Nxb5 Nc6 22. a3: Finding myself stuck, I randomly moved a piece
moves.23... Rxd8 24. Rxe3 g6: Blocking a possoble back rank mate, like I did
moves.25. Kh2: Waisting no time to that move
moves.25... Nd4: He was tring to get a pawn on the run, eh?
moves.26. Rd3 a6 27. Nc7 c4 28. Rc3: Leaving 2 undefended pawns- best for him being Nb5
moves.30... Nb5 31. Nxa6 Nc3 32. Ra3 Nd1 33. f: Pinning. The way is to set another attack
moves.34. Rd3 Nb2 35. Rb3 Kg7 36. Nc7 Ra2: Trapping his rook. I decided to horras his pawns
moves.37. Ne8+ Kf8 38. Nf6 h5 39. Nd5: My plan here was Nc3, forcing him to lose a knight
moves.39... Nc4 40. Rb8+ Kg7 41. Kg3 Ne5 42. K: He unexpectedly, led me to the corner
moves.46. f4: I've had quite enough of this
moves.46... Rg1 47. Rg3: Trying to get rid of pieces
moves.47... Rf1 48. Re3: Right then I noticed I made a big mistake. He could have forked my king and my rook, wich would lead to me resighning, but he still finds just as good of a way
moves.49... Ng2+: As of the move before, I blocked my kings only moving spot. I could not make it a rook and a pawn vs. a knight. I decided to resighn. Hope you liked my comments- bye!
